Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend two movies: "A Farewell to Arms" and "Trees Lounge".
"A Farewell to Arms" is a novel by Ernest Hemingway that was first published in 1925. The story follows two soldiers, John Dunbar and Frederic Henry, during World War I. As the war progresses, Dunbar becomes disillusioned with the fighting and begins to question his own purpose. Ultimately, Dunbar returns home to start a new life.
"Trees Lounge" is a novel by Tom King that was first published in 1986. The story follows four friends, George, John, Larry, and Moe, who have been running a "trees lounge" for several years. As the years pass, the tree lounge becomes more popular with people from all over the world.
